title: Sexy? logo
content:
This classy promotions company is equipped with female models that are sent out to clubs and events to promote liquor/beer. Any tips on the script?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [select.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924105832/http:/typophile.com/files/select.pdf) | 245.99 KB |

 [‹ Logo redesign for packaging company](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924105832/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36331 "Go to previous forum topic") [Neighborhood Logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924105832/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37298 "Go to next forum topic")
author: koleslaw

comments.content:
It’s very feminine, in a “Sex and the City” / women’s deodorant sort of way. To me it says “women who want to have fun on their terms” which might not be what you’re going for, depending on if the logo is to attract women or men.

- Lex

The letters don’t really connect. The outgoing angle of the first “e” doesn’t match the incoming angle of “l”, same with “l” and the second “e”, as well as the second “e” and “c”. At the very least, the strokes need a lot of fine tuning.

I think the promotions font doesn’t go with it.

David Daigle, Canada
